C. dignity of labour  D. humility. 
 
46. The second coming of Jesus Christ, according to Paul, 
will be preceded by the coming of 
A. Elijah the prophet 
B. John the Baptist 
C. the man of lawlessness 
D. the man of righteousness 
47. Is it not the rich who oppress you, is it not they who 
drag you into court? 
James asked his question in his teachings on 
A. humility   B.  impartiality C. loyalty 
D. citizenship 
49. The importance of love in the teaching of Peter is that 
it 
A. covers a multitude of sins 
B. brings together all believers in the community 
C. takes one eternal life 
D. extends to Christians only. 
 
50. According to Peter, when the Chief Shepherded is 
manifested, Christians will 
A. cast all their anxieties on Him 
B. obtain eternal life 
C. be saved from their sins 
D. obtain the unfading crown of glory. 
 
48. The wisdom of God is necessary for salvation, hence 
James teaches that Christians  should 
A. ask for it when they can 
B. endure all trials to get it 
C. ask in faith to get it 
D. claim it as a right. 
 
  CHRISTIAN  RELIGIOUS  KNOWLEDGE 1999  
 
 
 
1. “Behold, I have given you every plant yielding seed 
which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree 
with seed in its fruit; ...” 
In the statement above, God made all provision for man to 
A. tend and preserve 
B. have  enough food 
C. make a beautiful garden 
D. look at and admire 
 
2. God told Noah that ‘Whoever sheds the blood of man 
by man, shall his blood be shed; ... because 
A. man is made in God’s image 
B. man is his brother’s keeper 
C. blood is the life of man 
D. man was the last creature. 
 
3. What did God promise the Israelites after their rescue 
from Babylon to make them fear Him for ever? 
A. A new heart and a new life 
B. A new covenant and a new spirit 
C. Prosperity and security 
D. One heart and one way. 
 
4. The Lord appeared to Abraham and promised his 
descendants the land of the canaanites at 
A. Mount Sinai 
B. the Oaks of Mamre 
C. the Oak of Moreh 
D. the Mountain east of Bethel. 
 
5. When Joseph narrated his second dream, he was r 
ebuked by Jacob because the dream would 
A. make his brothers all the more jealous 
B. subject  his parents to his authority 
C. make the family harvest sheaves 
D. send the family to Egypt as slaves. 
 
6. Deborah was a judge when Israel was under the yoke 
of 
A. Moab  B.   Midian   C.  Canaan  D.   Philistine. 
 
7. When Jacob woke from sleep on his way to Haran, he 
was afraid and named the place Bethel because he 
believed that the 
A. place was a part of heaven 
B. place had a ladder that led to heaven 
C. angels of the Lord lived there 
D. place was the gate of heaven. 
 
8. God rejected the sons of Eli from being priest over His 
people because they were 
A. blasphemous and unrestrained 
B. avaricious and fearful 
C. thieves and murderers 
D. immoral and seditious. 
 
9. The final consequence of Saul’s disobedience to God 
was his 
A. defeat in battle 
B. abandonment by his armour-bearer 
C. dethronement by the people 
D. death in the war front. 
 
10. God forgave David when he took Bathsheba, the wife 
of Uriah because 
A. the child he had with her died 
B. David accepted his guilt 
C. David fasted and laid upon the ground 
D. David was a man after God’s heart. 
 
11. Abner sent messengers to David at Hebron because 
he wanted to 
A. bring over all Israel to David 
B. reconcile Ishbasheth with Judah 
C. spy on Hebron and capture it later 
D. reconcile David with Ishbosheth.
